verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:1
verses.text: The Epistle of Ignatius to the Romans Shorter and Longer Versions  Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the Church which has obtained mercy, through the majesty of the Most High Father, and Jesus Christ, His only-begotten Son; the Church which is beloved and enlightened by the will of Him that willeth all things which are according to the love of Jesus Christ our God, which also presides in the place of the region of the Romans, worthy of God, worthy of honour, worthy of the highest happiness, worthy of praise, worthy of obtaining her every desire, worthy of being deemed holy, and which presides over love, is named from Christ, and from the Father, which I also salute in the name of Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father: to those who are united, both according to the flesh and spirit, to every one of His commandments; who are filled inseparably with the grace of God, and are purified from every strange taint, I wish abundance of happiness unblameably, in Jesus Christ our God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:2
verses.text: Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the Church which has obtained mercy, through the majesty of the Most High God the Father, and of Jesus Christ, His only-begotten Son; the Church which is sanctified and enlightened by the will of God, who formed all things that are according to the faith and love of Jesus Christ, our God and Saviour; the Church which presides in the place of the region of the Romans, and which is worthy of God, worthy of honour, worthy of the highest happiness, worthy of praise, worthy of credit, worthy of being deemed holy, and which presides over love, is named from Christ, and from the Father, and is possessed of the Spirit, which I also salute in the name of Almighty God, and of Jesus Christ His Son: to those who are united, both according to the flesh and spirit, to every one of His commandments, who are filled inseparably with all the grace of God, and are purified from every strange taint, I wish abundance of happiness unblameably, in God, even the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:3
verses.text: Chapter 1 — As a prisoner, I hope to see you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:4
verses.text: Through prayer to God I have obtained the privilege of seeing your most worthy faces, and have even been granted more than I requested; for I hope as a prisoner in Christ Jesus to salute you, if indeed it be the will of God that I be thought worthy of attaining unto the end.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:5
verses.text: For the beginning has been well ordered, if I may obtain grace to cling to my lot without hindrance unto the end.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:6
verses.text: For I am afraid of your love, lest it should do me an injury.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:7
verses.text: For it is easy for you to accomplish what you please; but it is difficult for me to attain to God, if ye spare me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:8
verses.text: Through prayer to God I have obtained the privilege of seeing your most worthy faces, even as I earnestly begged might be granted me; for as a prisoner in Christ Jesus I hope to salute you, if indeed it be the will of God that I be thought worthy of attaining unto the end.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:9
verses.text: For the beginning has been well ordered, if I may obtain grace to cling to my lot without hindrance unto the end.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:10
verses.text: For I am afraid of your love, lest it should do me an injury.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 1:11
verses.text: For it is easy for you to accomplish what you please; but it is difficult for me to attain to God, if ye do not spare me, under the pretence of carnal affection.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:1
verses.text: Chapter 2 — Do not save me from martyrdom.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:2
verses.text: For it is not my desire to act towards you as a man-pleaser, but as pleasing God, even as also ye please Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:3
verses.text: For neither shall I ever have such another opportunity of attaining to God; nor will ye, if ye shall now be silent, ever be entitled to the honour of a better work.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:4
verses.text: For if ye are silent concerning me, I shall become God's; but if you show your love to my flesh, I shall again have to run my race.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:5
verses.text: Pray, then, do not seek to confer any greater favour upon me than that I be sacrificed to God while the altar is still prepared; that, being gathered together in love, ye may sing praise to the Father, through Christ Jesus, that God has deemed me, the bishop of Syria, worthy to be sent for from the east unto the west.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:6
verses.text: It is good to set from the world unto God, that I may rise again to Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:7
verses.text: For it is not my desire that ye should please men, but God, even as also ye do please Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:8
verses.text: For neither shall I ever hereafter have such an opportunity of attaining to God; nor will ye, if ye shall now be silent, ever be entitled to the honour of a better work.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:9
verses.text: For if ye are silent concerning me, I shall become God's; but if ye show your love to my flesh, I shall again have to run my race.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 2:10
verses.text: Pray, then, do not seek to confer any greater favour upon me than that I be sacrificed to God, while the altar is still prepared; that, being gathered together in love, ye may sing praise to the Father, through Christ Jesus, that God has deemed me, the bishop of Syria, worthy to be sent for from the east unto the west, and to become a martyr in behalf of His own precious sufferings, so as to pass from the world to God, that I may rise again unto Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:1
verses.text: Chapter 3 — Pray rather that I may attain to martyrdom.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:2
verses.text: Ye have never envied any one; ye have taught others.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:3
verses.text: Now I desire that those things may be confirmed by your conduct, which in your instructions ye enjoin on others.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:4
verses.text: Only request in my behalf both inward and outward strength, that I may not only speak, but truly will; and that I may not merely be called a Christian, but really be found to be one.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:5
verses.text: For if I be truly found a Christian, I may also be called one, and be then deemed faithful, when I shall no longer appear to the world.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:6
verses.text: Nothing visible is eternal.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:7
verses.text: "For the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:8
verses.text: For our God, Jesus Christ, now that He is with the Father, is all the more revealed in His glory.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:9
verses.text: Christianity is not a thing of silence only, but also of manifest greatness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:10
verses.text: Ye have never envied any one; ye have taught others.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:11
verses.text: Now I desire that those things may be confirmed by your conduct, which in your instructions ye enjoin on others.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:12
verses.text: Only request in my behalf both inward and outward strength, that I may not only speak, but truly will, so that I may not merely be called a Christian, but really found to be one.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:13
verses.text: For if I be truly found a Christian, I may also be called one, and be then deemed faithful, when I shall no longer appear to the world.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:14
verses.text: Nothing visible is eternal.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:15
verses.text: "For the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:16
verses.text: The Christian is not the result of persuasion, but of power.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:17
verses.text: When he is hated by the world, he is beloved of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 3:18
verses.text: For says the Scripture, "If ye were of this world, the world would love its own; but now ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of it: continue in fellowship with me".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:1
verses.text: Chapter 4 — Allow me to fall a prey to the wild beasts.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:2
verses.text: I write to the Churches, and impress on them all, that I shall willingly die for God, unless ye hinder me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:3
verses.text: I beseech of you not to show an unseasonable good-will towards me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:4
verses.text: Suffer me to become food for the wild beasts, through whose instrumentality it will be granted me to attain to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:5
verses.text: I am the wheat of God, and let me be ground by the teeth of the wild beasts, that I may be found the pure bread of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:6
verses.text: Rather entice the wild beasts, that they may become my tomb, and may leave nothing of my body; so that when I have fallen asleep in death, I may be no trouble to any one.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:7
verses.text: Then shall I truly be a disciple of Christ, when the world shall not see so much as my body.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:8
verses.text: Entreat Christ for me, that by these instruments I may be found a sacrifice to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:9
verses.text: I do not, as Peter and Paul, issue commandments unto you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:10
verses.text: They were apostles; I am but a condemned man: they were free, while I am, even until now, a servant.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:11
verses.text: But when I suffer, I shall be the freed-man of Jesus, and shall rise again emancipated in Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:12
verses.text: And now, being a prisoner, I learn not to desire anything worldly or vain.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:13
verses.text: I write to all the Churches, and impress on them all, that I shall willingly die for God, unless ye hinder me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:14
verses.text: I beseech of you not to show an unseasonable good-will towards me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:15
verses.text: Suffer me to become food for the wild beasts, through whose instrumentality it will be granted me to attain to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:16
verses.text: I am the wheat of God, and am ground by the teeth of the wild beasts, that I may be found the pure bread of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:17
verses.text: Rather entice the wild beasts, that they may become my tomb, and may leave nothing of my body; so that when I have fallen asleep in death, I may not be found troublesome to any one.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:18
verses.text: Then shall I be a true disciple of Jesus Christ, when the world shall not see so much as my body.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:19
verses.text: Entreat the Lord for me, that by these instruments I may be found a sacrifice to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:20
verses.text: I do not, as Peter and Paul, issue commandments unto you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:21
verses.text: They were apostles of Jesus Christ, but I am the very least of believers: they were free, as the servants of God; while I am, even until now, a servant.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:22
verses.text: But when I suffer, I shall be the freed-man of Jesus Christ, and shall rise again emancipated in Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 4:23
verses.text: And now, being in bonds for Him, I learn not to desire anything worldly or vain.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:1
verses.text: Chapter 5 — I desire to die.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:2
verses.text: From Syria even unto Rome I fight with beasts, both by land and sea, both by night and day, being bound to ten leopards, I mean a band of soldiers, who, even when they receive benefits, show themselves all the worse.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:3
verses.text: But I am the more instructed by their injuries to act as a disciple of Christ; "yet am I not thereby justified".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:4
verses.text: May I enjoy the wild beasts that are prepared for me; and I pray they may be found eager to rush upon me, which also I will entice to devour me speedily, and not deal with me as with some, whom, out of fear, they have not touched.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:5
verses.text: But if they be unwilling to assail me, I will compel them to do so.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:6
verses.text: Pardon me in this: I know what is for my benefit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:7
verses.text: Now I begin to be a disciple.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:8
verses.text: And let no one, of things visible or invisible, envy me that I should attain to Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:9
verses.text: Let fire and the cross; let the crowds of wild beasts; let tearings, breakings, and dislocations of bones; let cutting off of members; let shatterings of the whole body; and let all the dreadful torments of the devil come upon me: only let me attain to Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:10
verses.text: From Syria even unto Rome I fight with beasts, both by land and sea, both by night and day, being bound to ten leopards, I mean a band of soldiers, who, even when they receive benefits, show themselves all the worse.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:11
verses.text: But I am the more instructed by their injuries to act as a disciple of Christ; "yet am I not thereby justified".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:12
verses.text: May I enjoy the wild beasts that are prepared for me; and I pray that they may be found eager to rush upon me, which also I will entice to devour me speedily, and not deal with me as with some, whom, out of fear, they have not touched.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:13
verses.text: But if they be unwilling to assail me, I will compel them to do so.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:14
verses.text: Pardon me in this I know what is for my benefit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:15
verses.text: Now I begin to be a disciple, and have no desire after anything visible or invisible, that I may attain to Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 5:16
verses.text: Let fire and the cross; let the crowds of wild beasts; let breakings, tearings, and separations of bones; let cutting off of members; let bruising to pieces of the whole body; and let the very torment of the devil come upon me: only let me attain to Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:1
verses.text: Chapter 6 — By death I shall attain true life.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:2
verses.text: All the pleasures of the world, and all the kingdoms of this earth, shall profit me nothing.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:3
verses.text: It is better for me to die in behalf of Jesus Christ, than to reign over all the ends of the earth.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:4
verses.text: "For what shall a man be profited, if he gain the whole world, but lose his own soul?" Him I seek, who died for us: Him I desire, who rose again for our sake.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:5
verses.text: This is the gain which is laid up for me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:6
verses.text: Pardon me, brethren: do not hinder me from living, do not wish to keep me in a state of death; and while I desire to belong to God, do not ye give me over to the world.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:7
verses.text: Suffer me to obtain pure light: when I have gone thither, I shall indeed be a man of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:8
verses.text: Permit me to be an imitator of the passion of my God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:9
verses.text: If any one has Him within himself, let him consider what I desire, and let him have sympathy with me, as knowing how I am straitened.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:10
verses.text: All the ends of the world, and all the kingdoms of this earth, shall profit me nothing.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:11
verses.text: It is better for me to die for the sake of Jesus Christ, than to reign over all the ends of the earth.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:12
verses.text: "For what is a man profited, if he gain the whole world, but lose his own soul?" I long after the Lord, the Son of the true God and Father, even Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:13
verses.text: Him I seek, who died for us and rose again.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:14
verses.text: Pardon me, brethren: do not hinder me in attaining to life; for Jesus is the life of believers.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:15
verses.text: Do not wish to keep me in a state of death, for life without Christ is death.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:16
verses.text: While I desire to belong to God, do not ye give me over to the world.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:17
verses.text: Suffer me to obtain pure light: when I have gone thither, I shall indeed be a man of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:18
verses.text: Permit me to be an imitator of the passion of Christ, my God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 6:19
verses.text: If any one has Him within himself, let him consider what I desire, and let him have sympathy with me, as knowing how I am straitened.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:1
verses.text: Chapter 7 — Reason of desiring to die.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:2
verses.text: The prince of this world would fain carry me away, and corrupt my disposition towards God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:3
verses.text: Let none of you, therefore, who are in Rome help him; rather be ye on my side, that is, on the side of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:4
verses.text: Do not speak of Jesus Christ, and yet set your desires on the world.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:5
verses.text: Let not envy find a dwelling-place among you; nor even should I, when present with you, exhort you to it, be ye persuaded to listen to me, but rather give credit to those things which I now write to you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:6
verses.text: For though I am alive while I write to you, yet I am eager to die.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:7
verses.text: My love has been crucified, and there is no fire in me desiring to be fed; but there is within me a water that liveth and speaketh, saying to me inwardly, Come to the Father.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:8
verses.text: I have no delight in corruptible food, nor in the pleasures of this life.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:9
verses.text: I desire the bread of God, the heavenly bread, the bread of life, which is the flesh of Jesus Christ, the Son of God, who became afterwards of the seed of David and Abraham; and I desire the drink of God, namely His blood, which is incorruptible love and eternal life.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:10
verses.text: The prince of this world would fain carry me away, and corrupt my disposition towards God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:11
verses.text: Let none of you, therefore, who are in Rome help him; rather be ye on my side, that is, on the side of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:12
verses.text: Do not speak of Jesus Christ, and yet prefer this world to Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:13
verses.text: Let not envy find a dwelling-place among you; nor even should I, when present with you, exhort you to it, be ye persuaded, but rather give credit to those things which I now write to you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:14
verses.text: For though I am alive while I write to you, yet I am eager to die for the sake of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:15
verses.text: My love has been crucified, and there is no fire in me that loves anything; but there is living water springing up in me, and which says to me inwardly, Come to the Father.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:16
verses.text: I have no delight in corruptible food, nor in the pleasures of this life.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 7:17
verses.text: I desire the bread of God, the heavenly bread, the bread of life, which is the flesh of Jesus Christ, the Son of God, who became afterwards of the seed of David and Abraham; and I desire the drink, namely His blood, which is incorruptible love and eternal life.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:1
verses.text: Chapter 8 — Be ye favourable to me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:2
verses.text: I no longer wish to live after the manner of men, and my desire shall be fulfilled if ye consent.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:3
verses.text: Be ye willing, then, that ye also may have your desires fulfilled.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:4
verses.text: I entreat you in this brief letter; do ye give credit to me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:5
verses.text: Jesus Christ will reveal these things to you, so that ye shall know that I speak truly.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:6
verses.text: He is the mouth altogether free from falsehood, by which the Father has truly spoken.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:7
verses.text: Pray ye for me, that I may attain the object of my desire.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:8
verses.text: I have not written to you according to the flesh, but according to the will of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:9
verses.text: If I shall suffer, ye have wished well to me; but if I am rejected, ye have hated me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:10
verses.text: I no longer wish to live after the manner of men, and my desire shall be fulfilled if ye consent.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:11
verses.text: "I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet no longer I, since Christ liveth in me".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:12
verses.text: I entreat you in this brief letter: do not refuse me; believe me that I love Jesus, who was delivered to death for my sake.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:13
verses.text: "What shall I render to the Lord for all His benefits towards me?" Now God, even the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ, shall reveal these things to you, so that ye shall know that I speak truly.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:14
verses.text: And do ye pray along with me, that I may attain my aim in the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:15
verses.text: I have not written to you according to the flesh, but according to the will of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 8:16
verses.text: If I shall suffer, ye have loved me; but if I am rejected, ye have hated me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:1
verses.text: Chapter 9 — Pray for the church in Syria.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:2
verses.text: Remember in your prayers the Church in Syria, which now has God for its shepherd, instead of me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:3
verses.text: Jesus Christ alone will oversee it, and your love will also regard it.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:4
verses.text: But as for me, I am ashamed to be counted one of them; for indeed I am not worthy, as being the very last of them, and one born out of due time.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:5
verses.text: But I have obtained mercy to be somebody, if I shall attain to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:6
verses.text: My spirit salutes you, and the love of the Churches that have received me in the name of Jesus Christ, and not as a mere passer-by.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:7
verses.text: For even those Churches which were not near to me in the way, I mean according to the flesh, have gone before me, city by city, to meet me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:8
verses.text: Remember in your prayers the Church which is in Syria, which, instead of me, has now for its shepherd the Lord, who says, "I am the good Shepherd".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:9
verses.text: And He alone will oversee it, as well as your love towards Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:10
verses.text: But as for me, I am ashamed to be counted one of them; for I am not worthy, as being the very last of them, and one born out of due time.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:11
verses.text: But I have obtained mercy to be somebody, if I shall attain to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:12
verses.text: My spirit salutes you, and the love of the Churches which have received me in the name of Jesus Christ, and not as a mere passer-by.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 9:13
verses.text: For even those Churches which were not near to me in the way, have brought me forward, city by city.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:1
verses.text: Chapter 10 — Conclusion.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:2
verses.text: Now I write these things to you from Smyrna by the Ephesians, who are deservedly most happy.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:3
verses.text: There is also with me, along with many others, Crocus, one dearly beloved by me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:4
verses.text: As to those who have gone before me from Syria to Rome for the glory of God, I believe that you are acquainted with them; to whom, then, do ye make known that I am at hand.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:5
verses.text: For they are all worthy, both of God and of you; and it is becoming that you should refresh them in all things.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:6
verses.text: I have written these things unto you, on the day before the ninth of the Kalends of September (that is, on the twenty-third day of August).

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:7
verses.text: Fare ye well to the end, in the patience of Jesus Christ, Amen.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:8
verses.text: Now I write these things to you from Smyrna by the Ephesians, who are deservedly most happy.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:9
verses.text: There is also with me, along with many others, Crocus, one dearly beloved by me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:10
verses.text: As to those who have gone before me from Syria to Rome for the glory of God, I believe that you are acquainted with them; to whom, then, do ye make known that I am at hand.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:11
verses.text: For they are all worthy, both of God and of you; and it is becoming that you should refresh them in all things.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:12
verses.text: I have written these things unto you on the day before the ninth of the Kalends of September.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Romans 10:13
verses.text: Fare ye well to the end, in the patience of Jesus Christ.
